status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4agh4","text":"Designing gRNAs using https://chopchop.cbu.uib.no.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":22,"length":28}],"data":{}},{"key":"2tpdb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8r5i0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5924AAFC130E11EDB1220A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://chopchop.cbu.uib.no."}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8jba3","text":"I prefer this website because it also gives you the primer sequences for sequencing analysis.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"o4l8","text":"Choose the top-ranking gRNA sequences that target the earliest exon possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a6shq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"422fv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":37,"offset":74}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fb623","text":"Make sure that the targeted exon is shared between the isoforms (check on https://asia.ensembl.org/index.html).","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2o6h3","text":"If the protein is too big or it’s not possible to choose a target common in all the isoforms, you can use two different gRNAs.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"59D184BC130F11EDB1220A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://asia.ensembl.org/index.html)."},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"link"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3feju","text":"Click on the chosen target sequence, another window with all the information related to this gRNA sequence will appear.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"41qlu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1d0lq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bers9","text":"In this window, you can also find a table with primer pairs to amplify the targeted region for sequencing analysis.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5mk4k","text":"You can copy and paste these sequences into a word document and order them. ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ej2hn","text":"If no primers appear, go back to “Primers” tab from step one and change the parameters.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c9lod","text":"Copy the target sequence without the PAM into the highlighted region of the below sequence:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5quts","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8gn8p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":45,"offset":26,"style":"bold"}],"key":"bo5nm","text":"ATCTTGTGGAAAGGACGAAACACCG Copy the target sequence without the PAM here GTTTTAGAGCTAGAAATAGCAAGTT.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"avn06","text":"“Target”: Put in the gene name/“In”: choose the species.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8dlcu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9m9ak","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8e0q0","text":" For human cell lines, I choose “Homo sapiens (hg38/GRCh38)/“Using”: for knockout I choose “CRISPR/Cas9”/“For”: I choose “knock-out”.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eoudh","text":"Do not change anything in “General” tab.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dro7a","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1o209","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"57gvj","text":"Make sure in “target specific region of gene”, “Coding region” is chosen.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"74d5b","text":"In the “Cas9” tab, make sure you choose “No requirements” for “5’ requirements for sgRNA” and tick “I intend to replace the leading nucleotides with “GG”” (3 options of the “Sef-complementarity (Thyme et al.)” should be ticked).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4hu0j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73a2l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3tsjb","text":"Click “Find target sites”.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"56pe1","text":"In “Primers” tab, I choose product size from 200 to 500 and minimum distance from primer to target site at least 100.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cuvps","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f6fmb","text":"Order the above sequence as a primer for Gibson assembly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ctr7","text":"Dilute the primer from steps 4 and 5 to the final concentration of   (1/125 dilution of the   stock). Set up a Gibson assembly reaction as ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"95fh9","text":"The next day, pick up a few colonies and set up overnight cultures in growth broth.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dk57","text":"Miniprep the cultures to purify plasmids and send them for sequencing using this primer (5’ GCTCACCTCGACCATGGTAAT 3’).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bjt24","text":"Once sequenced verified, the CRISPR constructs are now ready to be used for transfection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
